alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 18 at 10:00PM CDT until June 18 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Lincoln Parish in north central Louisiana... * Until 1045 PM CDT. * At 1000 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Bernice, or 14 miles north of Ruston, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Lincoln Parish, including the following locations... Vienna, Unionville and Dubach. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
